text: Kind of a heffy yellow, with a thin white head. Aroma is pleasantly, and lightly hoppy, and taste is the same, with a grainy edge, and lemon-pepper hops.Drinkable, but nothing special, especially for a beer that probably cost $10

Bomber purchased at brewpub. Rich straw pour with modest head. A bit sweeter nose than your typical lager. Banana and spice. Clean lager flavor with nice hoppy lemon and zesty notes along with spicy earth. Real nice middleground is met between hoppiness and cleanliness. A crushable offering.
Lemon, orange zest, and sweet dough aromas. Taste is lemon rind, orange/tangerine, straw, and lightly sweetened bread.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2015 Solid beer. Later body is nice, plenty of hop flavor, though not too bitter had on tap, will try again in the bottle later.

Had again, even more enjoyable (3.6 --> 3.8)
Bottle, shared on the RBSG bus. Bright golden, lemony hops with vegetal undertones, clean crackery malts, crisply bitter finish. A characterful lager.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle @ RBSG 2015. Clear yellow pour with white foam. Has some nice fruity esters and citrusy hop notes. A good bit of floral and grassy character, too. Some lime seltzer, biscuit, and perhaps tea. Nice crisp malt flavor and a moderate bitterness. Not overly sweet. Kind of dusty. Was hoping for better.

Bottle on the RBSG party bus 
Clear golden with a medium sized white head, good lacing. Aroma is grassy and dusty. Taste is grassy and fruity  
Ok

22 oz. bottle, pours a hazy yellow blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings biscuity malt out upfront, with piney hops in there. Flavour brings out lots of piney and herbal hops, with grass and biscuity malt to back. Nothing special to be honest, but well-made.
22oz bottle pours out golden topped with a white head. Nose is pine citrus hops and grapefruit. Taste is more of the grainy hops and grapefruit.
Bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a medium white head. A sweet grainy nose. The flavor is big sweet fruity hops, oranges, tea.
Tap at the brewery. Aroma is a bit plain, bit herbal, bit of citrus. Taste is not so exciting. Bit of citrus, malt. Possibly a bit too boozy.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with medium creamy off white head that lasts. The aroma is wheat grass and fruity malt. Medium mouthfeel, wheat, light hop, citrus, good.

Tap for Gigantic and Friends

A: Clear gold with a thin white and some lacing. 

N: Grass, pine, dirt, damp leaves, cracker, some peppercorn, little to no citrus

T: Bitter with light maltiness. 

M: Medium body, lightly resinous, no alcohol presence. 

O: A throttled down version of Dreadnaught, which youll notice I dont much enjoy. This has that same dead hop presence as Dreadnaught, and its average at best.
